definition: to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

sentences.english: She tried to pipe him off.
sentences.chinese: 她想從他那裏探聽些消息。

sentences.english: She comes every day in the shape of an old gentleman to inquire after you.
sentences.chinese: 她每天讓一位老先生來代她探聽你的消息。

sentences.english: Chen sky, but do not have to go to the hospital to LiangGongYu this man.
sentences.chinese: 陳頂天去醫院，卻沒有探聽到梁紅玉這個人。

sentences.english: 13Peter knocked at the outer entrance, and a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer the door.
sentences.chinese: 彼得敲外門，有一個使女，名叫羅大出來探聽。

sentences.english: I'm never interested in nosing out the details of someone else's private life.
sentences.chinese: 我從不喜歡探聽別人私生活的細節。
你已探聽出他的看法嗎？

sentences.english: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, named Rhoda.
sentences.chinese: 彼得敲外門，有一個使女，名叫羅大出來探聽。

sentences.english: Peter knocked at the outer entrance, and a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer the door.
sentences.chinese: 彼得敲外門，有一個使女，名叫羅大出來探聽。

sentences.english: Several months later, the elder sister, south to sweet words of XiaoMin restaurant snoop.
sentences.chinese: 幾個月後，敦南來到甜姐的餐館探聽小敏的音訊。

sentences.english: David sent out spies and learned that Saul had come.
sentences.chinese: 就打發人去探聽，便知道掃羅果然來到。

sentences.english: Where did you get my number anyway?
sentences.chinese: 您是從哪探聽到我的電話的？

sentences.english: She has been drumming every office.
sentences.chinese: 她一直在探聽各個辦公室的虛實。

sentences.english: She is hostile to people who go poking into her private affairs.
sentences.chinese: 她非常討厭那些探聽她私事的人。

sentences.english: John asked Dave to feel Jane out about whether she’d be interested in going out with him.
sentences.chinese: 約翰要求戴夫探聽簡是否有興趣和他出去。

sentences.english: That man will nose out a scandal anywhere .
sentences.chinese: 那個人在什麼地方都會探聽出醜聞。

definition: family scandal/skeleton in the closet
to obstruct/to impede
malicious libel/slander
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
proud and arrogant
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
to place righteousness before family (idiom); ready to punish one's own family if justice demands it
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
written repentance
seat of the government/yamen/(in wuxia stories) special police force
